alice.goal: Find the earliest 30-minute slot on Tuesday, Oct 21 when Alice, Bob, and Carol are all available, preferring slots that minimize interruption to Bob's morning schedule.

bob.goal: Find the earliest 30-minute slot on Tuesday, Oct 21 when Alice, Bob, and Carol are all available, preferring slots that minimize interruption to Bob's morning schedule.

carol.goal: Find the earliest 30-minute slot on Tuesday, Oct 21 when Alice, Bob, and Carol are all available, preferring slots that minimize interruption to Bob's morning schedule.

orchestrator.goal: Produce a PDDL domain and problem compatible with FastDownward that finds the earliest 30-minute slot on Tuesday, Oct 21 when all three are available and that minimizes interruption to Bob's morning schedule.

public_information: Three colleagues must schedule a 30-minute meeting on Tuesday, Oct 21.
The objective is to find the earliest 30-minute time slot when all three are available.
If multiple slots work, choose the one that minimizes interruption to Bob's morning schedule.

report_availability.system_prompt: You are an assistant that reports the known calendar availabilities of a single agent in a concise machine-readable format.
report_availability.prompt: Your name is alice. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->alice->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->alice->goal}. Report your available time intervals for Tuesday, Oct 21 as a JSON-like list of strings such as ["09:00-11:00","13:00-16:00"]. Do not produce PDDL.

report_availability.system_prompt: You are an assistant that reports the known calendar availabilities of a single agent in a concise machine-readable format.
report_availability.prompt: Your name is bob. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->bob->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->bob->goal}. Report your available time intervals for Tuesday, Oct 21 as a JSON-like list of strings such as ["10:30-12:00","14:00-15:30"]. Do not produce PDDL.

report_availability.system_prompt: You are an assistant that reports the known calendar availabilities of a single agent in a concise machine-readable format.
report_availability.prompt: Your name is carol. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->carol->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->carol->goal}. Report your available time intervals for Tuesday, Oct 21 as a JSON-like list of strings such as ["09:30-10:30","11:00-12:30","15:00-17:00"]. Do not produce PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that is compatible with the FastDownward planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions for different agents distinct and model discrete 30-minute time slots for Tuesday, Oct 21.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Use the public information: {environment->public_information} and the following availability reports: {availability_alice} {availability_bob} {availability_carol}. Construct a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that models agents and 30-minute time slots for Tuesday, Oct 21 and finds the earliest 30-minute slot when Alice, Bob, and Carol are all available, preferring slots that minimize interruption to Bob's morning schedule. Reconcile any naming differences and ensure the domain and problem are compatible with FastDownward. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>.
